label: 枕草紙
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The meaning of pillow book" (makura sōshi) is uncertain, but the term is commonly thought to have designated some kind of notebook. A sōshi ("book") was a stitched fascicule of paper, often with leaves in a variety of colors (p. 651n). [DL Alt. pron., まくらぞうし. Cf. まくらのそうし, the Pillow Book of Sei Shonagon.]"
